meanings.definition: To place in a new or different position.
meanings.sent1: She resituates the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer resituates the furniture for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The cat resituates its toys all around the house.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces resituate themselves into a new pattern.
meanings.sent5: The teacher resituates the students for group work.

meanings.definition: To relocate or move to a different place.
meanings.sent1: He resituates his office to a quieter location.
meanings.sent2: The company resituates its headquarters to a bigger city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resituates its nuts to a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The river resituates its course after heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The family resituates to a new neighborhood for better schools.
